TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

that isn't a hyperlink dude, it's a file address in your system, so it only works on your computer (unless someone has an image with the same title in the same folders on their computer, but then if the images are different it still won't work). ARGH. I installed this just to be met with this: [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=567909012](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=567909012)

I'm running an AMD r9 280x LC, AMD fx 8350,  tried in both dx9 and dx11. What might be causing this?

Weird graphical artefacts on the new water shaders on Linux.

[http://imgur.com/a/Cx1Sb](http://imgur.com/a/Cx1Sb)
Is there any way you can turn off the sky shaders so you just have the ocean shaders?
I use OpenGL on WIndows, and my water is semi-transparent. I can see the outline of ocean bottom in distance, looks very weird. I remember very similar bug in a WIP-EVE about a year ago.

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/), [@Nhawks17](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/32999-nhawks17/), [@rbray89](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/48847-rbray89/) you have ruined me. I have no idea what's causing these now. Please read the thread before posting, these get posted 10 times every page. Please stop reporting bugs that are already reported.

Some people suggested disabling edge highlighting helps. Again, read the thread.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, T1mo98 said:
> 
> 
> Is there any way you can turn off the sky shaders so you just have the ocean shaders?
> 

Not right now, the ocean shader works off the sky shader in many ways. I could implement this but I have no interest in it.

> 
> 
> 10 minutes ago, sashan said:
> 
> 
> I use OpenGL on WIndows, and my water is semi-transparent. I can see the outline of ocean bottom in distance, looks very weird. I remember very similar bug in a WIP-EVE about a year ago.
> 

This is not a bug, this is the alpha value set to 0.9. Adjust it, variable alpha depending on distance/agnle is not implemented yet.

> 
>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-03T22:19:00Z" title="12/03/2015 10:19  PM" data-short="8 yr">December 3, 2015</time> by xxjetterxx**

I was testing too, and I still don't have any positive results. I tried different configurations combining different values of anti-aliasing and texture quality, disabling surface and underwater FX. Testing more tomorrow.

OK, seems as I have managed to reproduce the issue here... Loaded up a save where EVE had not been involved. Scatterer works just fine on Laythe. Then I copied EVE into gamedata and re-started. The ocean went back to those previous pictures I posted with a few waves on top of a flat sea. And even though I removed EVE after this, the savegame was somehow influenced by EVE. I could never come back to complete oceans again.

![1E7C47949D84DF57E3E367E8729BBFFB897484CB](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/575696032781492216/1E7C47949D84DF57E3E367E8729BBFFB897484CB/)
